answers.answer: Hi!Mild diffuse cortical atrophy is usually seen as an age related process where minute portions of parts of brain called cortex die. Usually seen in old age or after traumatic brain injury or as complication of prolonged hypertension, diabetes, metabolic disorders etc.Encephalomalacia is not an illness. It is basically a softening of the brain matter as a result of an ischemia or infarction, degenerative changes, infection, craniocerebral trauma, or other injury. Posterior horn of right lateral ventricle (CSF filled space) is dilated giving an impression of encephalomalacia in that region. Please discuss with your doctor.
